title: Newsmax - Wikipedia
snippet: On November 15, 2020, The Wall Street Journal reported that Hicks Equity Partners, a private equity firm with ties to a co-chair of the Republican National Committee, was exploring a buyout of Newsmax. The Hicks group identified a team of executives who would manage the network, and had been talking to former Fox News hosts including Megyn Kelly. Media analyst Michael Nathanson reported that if a competing network took 20% of Fox News' audience, it could sap about $200 million in annual profit from the company.

title: NewsMax Executive Team | Comparably
snippet: Jim Tremblay serves as the Vice President - Ad Sales of NewsMax. ... Jason Villar serves as the VP of Media & Market Research of NewsMax.

title: Christopher Ruddy - Wikipedia
snippet: Christopher Ruddy (born January 28, 1965) is an American journalist and business executive. A political conservative, Ruddy is the CEO and majority owner of Newsmax Media.

title: Newsmax - News Media Bias Rating | AllSides
snippet: Learn the AllSides Media Bias Rating of Newsmax - News. AllSides rates the media bias of hundreds of media outlets, journalists, and sources.

title: Newsmax - Bias and Credibility - Media Bias/Fact Check
snippet: Newsmax is an American conservative biased news and opinion website founded by Christopher Ruddy in 1998 and based in West Palm Beach, Florida. Christopher Ruddy is the president and CEO of Newsmax Media.
